headline: How RBC’s Upgrade and Steady Dividend At Colgate-Palmolive (CL) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Colgate-Palmolive’s board has declared a quarterly cash dividend of US$0.52 per share, payable on February 13, 2026, to shareholders of record on January 21, 2026, continuing its long history of regular payouts. At the same time, an upgrade to an Outperform rating from RBC Capital Markets highlights renewed confidence in Colgate-Palmolive’s ability to pursue long-term growth despite industry headwinds. We’ll now examine how RBC’s upgrade, grounded in confidence about long-term growth...

headline: Colgate-Palmolive Stock Should Do Better in 2026, but That's Not Saying Much
summary: There are some catalysts that could power a rebound for the consumer packaged goods giant in 2026, but even if one occurs, the returns are unlikely to be astounding.

headline: Colgate-Palmolive (CL) Rated Outperform by RBC as Long-Term Growth Remains in Focus
summary: Colgate-Palmolive Company (NYSE:CL) is included among the 15 Best Stocks to Buy for the Long Term. On December 9, RBC Capital raised its rating on Colgate-Palmolive Company (NYSE:CL) to Outperform from Sector Perform while keeping the price target at $88. The analyst noted that the stock has been under pressure recently as slower global category […]
